## 판결문 요약








								







	

	





						

			IN THE COURT OF CRIMINAL APPEALS


OF TEXAS






NO. PD-1036-05






ADAM TROY GRIFFIN, Appellant


						

v.



THE STATE OF TEXAS







ON APPELLANT'S PETITION FOR DISCRETIONARY REVIEW 


FROM THE TENTH COURT OF APPEALS

FALLS COUNTY





	Hervey, J., delivered the opinion of the Court in which Keller, P.J., Meyers,
Womack, Keasler, Holcomb and Cochran, JJ., joined.  Price and Johnson, JJ.,
dissented.


O P I N I O N


	This is a "stop and frisk," (1) "plain-feel" (2) case.  The police stopped and detained appellant in
a public area to investigate whether he was selling crack cocaine.  We decide that the police legally
seized crack cocaine from inside appellant's pocket during a pat-down search of the pocket.

	The evidence in this case shows that appellant was arrested for possessing a small amount
of residue cocaine in a "long plastic tube" about two days before the incident in question (the legality
of this arrest is not at issue in this case).   One or two days later, a confidential informant, whom the
police considered reliable, provided the police (narcotics investigator Kingsley) with information that
